text: Caeau Llety-cybi is a Site of Special Scientific Interest in Ceredigion, west Wales. The lowland meadow site is managed by the Wildlife Trust of South & West Wales. The reserve consists of four small herb-rich fields of neutral grassland showing some acidic characteristics. Sward species include sweet vernal grass, common bent, and Heath-grass with a wealth of flowers, such as Bird's-foot trefoil, Black knapweed, Burnet saxifrage, Cat's ear, Ivy-leaved bellflower, Pignut, Red clover, Tormentil, Betony and Greater butterfly orchid.https://www.welshwildlife.org/nature-reserve/caeau-llety-cybi-llangybi- ceredigion/ The site has waxcap fungi, probably encouraged by a lack of ploughing. ==See also== *List of Sites of Special Scientific Interest in Ceredigion ==References== Category:Sites of Special Scientific Interest in Ceredigion
title: Caeau Llety-cybi
